posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Barbarian-Pale masters are a somewhat unknown force in the NwN universe, most prefer the plethora of Fighter feats and the heavy armour. And truly they are hard to do since they have to be fine-tuned to the last detail to explore their capabilities in the fullest. Today i will present you with a Berserker that is perhaps the finest of his kind, he sits on 37 AC without any buffs with just mundane plate & shield, has the highest AB of any other undead barbarian or fighter, comes with a complete almost three hundrend skill points set, all the essential combat feats and yes, it also delivers Devastating blows to his enemies while they run unable to resist his Terrifying rage that has a will save DC in the fifty's. You also get to enjoy my mediocre attempt at a short tale for him..


THE TALE OF THE UNSUNG BERSERKER:


...He wore eyes of pale that looked into nothingness and the once majestic armour was nothing but

tattered remains that felt like they would crumble and fall off his grey skin. In his hands he wielded

nothing but the grip of his trusted sword, the one that they put on his chest the time he died, nothing

from the once razor-sharp edge remained, but he knew-he could feel it, that his skill and power

would make this slab of iron deadly for his foes. Were others may cut, he would crush their sculls

with brute force, for such is the power he was given from the grave...


He stopped for a while and let the rain fall on him silently, he heared the sounds of battle once again

and flexed his muscles preparing for the charge. The enemy was near... Fine, let them have it if that

is what they want! And then he threw his head back for a moment and when he was back from that

moment he let a warcry that shook the heavens with its intensity, and launched himself forward

without a second thought... And the cries of his foes covered the battleground...


– Run, run for you lives!

– No, mercy... please spare me!


Seeing from afar the lord of darkness sent his best warriors, one after the other and all of them would

fail before the furious unknown warrior, such was his lust for blood, so great his blows that soon,

none could even dare approach him. And it was that time the dark lord, the scion of the dark realms

that choose to sent his best fighter to face this unstoppable force of terror.


All others stepped aside as the hooded figure approached the blood covered berserker, and as he

moved forward, he unveiled his instrament of destruction, a sight to behold. Red runes covered the

curved blade in it's entire length, a soft crimson light emited from the weapon itself like it

had a soul of its own. And this fighter could stand the terror of the berserker and dare look him

straight in the eyes. They stood facing each other for mere seconds that seemed like an eternity, then

suddenly the hooded figure rose his enormous blade up and with a masteful stroke he hit fast and

hard on the berserker, delivering a blow that would finish any mortal foe! The strike from his sword

shattered the armour in the place it hit and opened a big wound, blood gush forth for first time in

battle for the berserker. But he stood motionless, still standing, still grasping firmly his sword in his

hands, and then he laughed, he laughed almost manically for the first time after years, finally

someone has challenged him in equal terms! He laughed and then het loose his terrifying rage and

propelled forward with unparalleled ferocity! And with a single reverse stroke of his dull blade he

severed the head of his opponent from his shoulders, crushing entirely bones and spinal cord alike.

And it was that moment that the dark lord realized the battle was lost...


And the fight went on till the sun went red and the berserker was all-covered in blood and gore and

nothing but him remained on the battlefield, and only then his rage ceased - for as long as a single

enemy remained standing he could not let his mind take control. Then the golden general approached

him slowly, not neing sure herself if she was safe to come nearby him at this moment.


– You should have stopped once I gave the call for it

– You blew the golden horn and I answered the call as I am obliged to do so, golden general but the ways I fight are my own and mine only and I won't apologize for them

– You are right of course, it was me that I called you from the realms of the dead, but I did not think
that you would make such a bloodshed, this is a scene macabre!

– Victory is not pretty my lady..

And that, was all he said as he turned to leave once again returning to the lands beyond the mortal

realms, to the silence of the grave...


A hero that tales don't dare tell his story...

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Dev crit and PM immunities is a classic. Combined with TR, Dev crit is just mean.
BAB 30, Str 30, AB +44 are solid warrior features.
AC 37 in mudane armor (38 with a pot of Cat's) is almost beyond the living.
And the great skill selection has the signature of a "bardbarian".

Most assassins would jump to the shadows at the sight of this monster and take a long walk.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content: Starting with a Half-Orc: (Str 20 (34) - Dex 8 - Con 12 - Int 14 - Wis 8 - Cha 6) you go as normal but you replace "Power attack, Cleave and Great Cleave" with "Expertise and Improved Knockdown" you lose the third feat because you are not a Human anymore. In Epic levels you will then replace Overwhelming and Devastating Critical with two additional Great Strengths. This variation of the main build is better on PW's or Modules that Dev. Critical is not desirable, it mainly goes for more constant attack bonus/ damage so to speak.

posts.author: TychoVelius
posts.content:
Thinking of playing this on WoG - This could work with Greatsword or Scimitar, right? Is longsword for flavor?

Something with a shield would probably be good, in keeping with all the AC you get from PM.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content: Aye, you could play this with whatever martial weapon you like, the longsword is there for flavour & because there are many powerful iterations of this weapon in every module or PW making it a good choice overall. In WoG a Pale-Warrior is one of the strongest choices you could play with enemy WM's being a common choice for a Boss encounter and the Drow, having them in spades.

posts.author: TychoVelius
posts.content:
I wouldn't want to do it with a battleaxe, because of the lower crit chance, right? Or is there a benefit for the higher multiplier with Dev Crit? (not that I'll actually have Dev Crit for a while...)

And a general note for WoG, do you start at level 2 or take the bonus potions?

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
I generally take the second level.

No, there is no benefit whatsoever in having a higher crit multiplier to devastating critical, I had thought of a "house rule" that would benefit more those weapons but no PW (or module) that I have seen had something similar. (Higher multiplier weapons took a bonus +2DC to dev critical per degree, a scythe, for example, would have +6DC in the hands of a weapon master).
